Course Name: ACG 2062 - ACCOUNTING INFORMATION FOR BUSINESS DECISIONS
Course Description: IDENTIFIES HOW ACCOUNTING INFORMATION IS USED IN MAKING BUSINESS DECISIONS.  STUDENTS ENHANCE COMPUTER SKILLS USING SOFTWARE PROGRAMS TO SOLVE ACCOUNTING PROBLEMS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
UPON COMPLETION OF THE COURSE, STUDENTS ARE ABLE TO:
1.USE SPREADSHEET SOFTWARE TO CREATE AND INTERPRET FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING DATA
2.USE SPREADSHEET SOFTWARE TO CREATE AND INTERPRET MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING DATA 
3.USE COMMERCIAL SOFTWARE TO CREATE AND INTERPRET FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING DATA
4.USE SPREADSHEET SOFTWARE TO COMMUNICATE FINANCIAL, INVESTING AND OPERATING ACTIVITIES FOR A BUSINESS TO USERS OF ACCOUNTING INFORMATION.
5.USE SPREADSHEET SOFTWARE TO PRESENT AND ANALYZE DATA USED IN MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING DECISION-MAKING.  
6.IMPROVE RESEARCH, ORAL AND WRITTEN COMMUNICATION SKILLS
7.REINFORCE ETHICAL AND PROFESSIONAL BUSINESS CONDUCT
